comment_text: Nice video, but the moon's day is longer than the moon's year, around 2 days longer... due to the fact that the earth circles around the sun :)
Why is the moon rotationally locked though? do any other moons do this?

I don't personally like the term "Tidal Locking" it's an inaccurate and misleading term to describe the Moon's rotation.

Saying the Moon is tidal locked is the equivalent of saying the tides are the reason the moon has it's rotation. This is not the case at all, it is the Moon's orbit that causes the tides.

Granted, the Earth's oceans certainly affect the moon as well, however, it still doesn't negate the fact that the term is inaccurate.

It would make much more sense to say the moon's rotation has gravitationally locked over the course of it's existence. This is essentially the case anyway as the gravity of both the moon and the earth  affect one another, the moon on the other hand was most likely spinning at a much slower rate when it first formed and being smaller, it slowed down to the point where it's rotational period became locked to it's orbital period.

The same thing will happen to Earth to the Sun in several billion years as the Earth's rotational speed will continue to slow. It has in fact slowed down by about 8 hours at least over the course of it's existence. ;)

The unfortunate thing about the animation is that the animator has done a poor job translating the 3D world in his 2D image. As we look at the video, our perspective is from space looking down on the world and the moon. We see the axis spinning in the middle and hence the same face. Unfortunately, if this animation was translated from the perspective of the Earth, it wrongly appears that the Earth looks at the side with the flag that rotates -- which is incorrect and contrary to the facts and the message of the narrator.

These 10-second videos remind me of the "specials" on the Tomorrow's World TV programme.  No wonder they axed Tomorrow's World in the end.

Let's hope we don't keep having too many 10-second videos.

Breathe.

Time.

Tired of lying in the sunshine staying home to watch the rain

And then one day you find ten years have got behing you

Home, home again
I like to be here when I can

The tolling of the iron bell
Calls the faithful to their knees
To hear the softly spoken magic spells.



Money.



Money, get away
Get a good job with more pay and you're O.K.
Money, it's a gas

Money, it's a crime

Us And Them.



Us and them
And after all we're only ordinary men
Me and you
God only knows it's not what we would choose to do

Black and blue
And who knows which is which and who is who
Up and Down

The lunatic is on the grass
